name: Aorta
desc:
Find largest diamater. Is it > 3cm?
Transverse view can be A clip OR 4 transverse still views. 
Have enough depth to identify the verteral body

name: Biliary
desc:
Are there gallstones? Signs of biliary inflammation?
Gallbladder can be a sweep-through or two still images.
Measure anterior wall.

name: Cardiac
desc:
Check for RV dilation and pericaridal effusion
Estimate LV ejection fraction.
Requires at least 2 of the following 4 views:

name: DVT
desc:
Are the veins fully compressible?
Two zones: Femoral and Popliteal

name: EFAST
desc:
3 abdominal views to assess for free fluid.
2 Cardiac views to assess pericardial effusion.
2 Lung views to assess for penumothorax and hemothorax

name: Respiratory
desc:
Check for lung sliding, B-line, and pleural effusion.
Four zones: Anterior (midclavicular) and lateral (midaxillary), bilateral

name: OB/GYN
desc:
Is there a definitive uterine pregnancy?
Can be done transabdominally or transvaginally.

name: Ocular
desc: Requires at least 2 of the following 4 views:

name: Renal
desc: Requires at least 2 of the following 4 views:

name: Soft tissue
desc: Requires at least 2 of the following 4 views:
